comments:
I get a reproducable NPE (see details below) when I am trying to start my application with a self-defined config.ini (even if the contents of this config.ini is the same as the generated one by pde launch). It works fine when I let pde launch create the config.ini file (with the same contents) automatically.



eclipse.buildId=I20060413-1718
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Framework arguments:  -showLocation
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -showLocation

Error
Tue Aug 22 09:48:43 CEST 2006
An internal error occurred during: "Launching".

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform.getSymbolicName(TargetPlatform.java:172)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform.stripPathInformation(TargetPlatform.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.LaunchConfigurationHelper.createConfigIniFile(LaunchConfigurationHelper.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher.EclipseApplicationLaunchConfiguration.getProgramArguments(EclipseApplicationLaunchConfiguration.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher.AbstractPDELaunchConfiguration.launch(AbstractPDELaunchConfiguration.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:639)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:565)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:754)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:944)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
hi Martin, can you tell me what your target platform is set to?

The target platform in my case is an Equinox 3.2 installation plus some additional Equinox 3.2 plugins.

Meanwhile it looks like the PDE launch (or some other component) has problems with the format of the osgi.bundles property value. Aside of the fact that I copied this out of the generated config.ini file in the launch directory it works better if I change the bundle names of the workspace bundles from the complete path (reference, file, etc.) to a relative one (../org.bundle, just found out by trial and error). Have no clue about that but maybe it helps you?
The area of code the NPE is coming from does suggest a problem with the osgi.bundles tag.  What is the osgi.bundles value for the custom config.ini that is giving your an NPE?
Martin, can you attach the config.ini please?

I am sorry but I lost this old config.ini file somehow and I am not able to reproduce the problem in my current settings... :-(

I will investigate this in more detail and let you know when I found the setting that produces this exception.

Hi Martin, I noticed this bug is almost 3 months old.  We have done quite a bit with launching files, so can you please try your scenario against 3.3M4?  If it does not fail and we can't reproduce this bug, I would like to mark it as a worksForMe.

Hi Brian,

since I am currently not able to reproduce this bug anyway, lets close as worksforme. If I observe the problem again I will test against 3.3Mx and reopen, if necessary. Thanks again!!!
